Create the performance directory and move stress tests there.

Use RAMLibrary to limit the transport_stress test to only run when there is enough RAM available.

UPDATE: make pull request to point to performance_low_mem_test

content.raw: SUCCEED() will not stop the test and return a succeed, it will leave the rest of the test run. I've added a 'return' after the SUCCEED(), it should help to stop the test.
content.html: SUCCEED() will not stop the test and return a succeed, it will leave the rest of the test run. I've added a 'return' after the SUCCEED(), it should help to stop the test.

content.raw: I had to re-run the gazebo-any job, since r2d2 had a gzserver process hanging around. After killing it, the next job failed with the same behavior I reported above. http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64/70/console

content.raw:
I just ran it on a virtual machine, and I adjusted the memory to be less than 1700 MB, so it prints `Dbg Skipped test since1700Mb of RAM were not available `, but the test didn't stop. I wonder if the SUCCEED() function isn't working properly with ServerFixture? Have you experienced this?

EDIT: I just started a gazebo-any job for this branch. http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64/69/
content.html:
I just ran it on a virtual machine, and I adjusted the memory to be less than 1700 MB, so it prints Dbg Skipped test since1700Mb of RAM were not available, but the test didn't stop. I wonder if the SUCCEED() function isn't working properly with ServerFixture? Have you experienced this?

EDIT: I just started a gazebo-any job for this branch. http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64/69/

content.html:
These if statements could be moved out of the #ifdef block by defining unsigned int requiredMB in the #ifdef and referencing the variable.

if (! gazebo::test::memory::IsMemoryAvailable(requiredMB))
{
  gzdbg << "Skipped test since " << requiredMB << "Mb of RAM were not available\n";
}

Also, there's a syntax error on line 135, gazebo::test:memory::IsMemoryAvailable, missing a :.
